newsitem.title: INDIA: India's RBI sees rupee stable in coming months.
newsitem.headline: India's RBI sees rupee stable in coming months.

text.p: Reserve Bank of India (RBI) Governor Chakravarty Rangarajan on Thursday said the rupee would remain stable in the coming months of 1996/97 (April-March).

"In the current financial year the rupee has remained reasonably stable and supply and demand positions in the exchange market are well equilibrated and will remain so in the coming months," Rangarajan said in a speech delivered in New Delhi.
